originalTitle: Kenya's border with Somalia set to re-open after almost 15 years
title: Kenya's border with Somalia set to re-open after almost 15 years
content: Somali Islamist militant group al-Shabab has staged several attacks in Kenya, prompting the border to be closed.

originalTitle: Port city in ruins as storm rips through Madagascar and on towards Mozambique
title: Port city in ruins as storm rips through Madagascar and on towards Mozambique
content: More than half the population is affected and most infrastructure destroyed in Toamasina, Madagascar's main port.

originalTitle: At least 21 dead after boat sinks on Sudan's River Nile
title: Sad News and Helping Hands on the Big River Nile in Sudan
content:
Hello, My African Friends!

Hello everyone! It’s your kid-friendly news reporter here, bringing you important stories from our amazing continent, Africa. Today, we have some sad news from a country called Sudan. Sudan is a beautiful country in North Africa, full of warm people and big, open spaces. It's a place with lots of history and a very, very famous river.

The Great River Nile

Sudan is special because a huge, long river flows right through it. This river is called the River Nile. It's not just any river; it's one of the longest rivers in the whole world! Imagine a super long snake of water winding its way through many countries, and that's the Nile!

Did you know? The River Nile helps so many people. Farmers use its water to grow yummy food like wheat and cotton. People also drink its water and sometimes, they travel on it in boats. The Nile is like a super important lifeline for Sudan, giving life to plants, animals, and people!

A Sad Day on the Water

Sadly, something very, very sad happened on the River Nile recently. A boat was carrying many people across the water. On the boat were grown-ups, and even some little boys and girls, maybe just like you. They were traveling from one place to another, probably to visit family or go to school or market.

But then, there was a big problem. The boat had an accident and it went under the water. This is what we call 'sinking'. It was a very unexpected and scary thing to happen. Nobody wanted this sad accident to occur, but sometimes things go wrong.

Many People Lost

Because of this sad accident, many people on the boat were lost. The news tells us that at least 21 people did not make it back. And the saddest part is that some of these people were children. Little ones who loved to play and laugh, just like you. It's a very sad time for their families and for the whole country of Sudan.

It makes our hearts feel heavy to hear about such a tragedy. When we think of little children, we imagine them playing safely and happily. So, it's very difficult to hear that some children were on that boat and are now missed very much by their loved ones.

Brave Helpers Are Searching

When the boat sank, many brave and kind people rushed to help. These helpers are called search and rescue teams. They came with their own boats and worked very hard. They looked everywhere in the big river, hoping to find the missing passengers. They are still searching even now, looking for anyone who might still be found.

Did you know? When a sad event like this happens, people from the community often come together to help. This spirit of helping each other is very strong in Africa. People support their neighbors and friends in difficult times, showing great kindness and courage.

These helpers are truly heroes. They are not giving up, and they are doing their very best to bring comfort to the families who are waiting for news. It takes a lot of bravery and strength to keep searching in the water, especially when it's for many days.

Why Do Boats Sink?

Sometimes, boats can have problems. Maybe they carry too many people, making the boat too heavy. Or perhaps the weather suddenly gets bad, and big waves hit the boat. Sometimes, a boat might be old or not strong enough for the journey. We don't know exactly why this boat sank, but these are some reasons why boat accidents can happen.

Did you know? It's super important for boats to be safe. That means having enough life jackets for everyone on board! A life jacket is like a special floaty vest that helps you stay on top of the water if you accidentally fall in. It can save lives!

Thinking of Sudan

All of us in Africa are thinking about the people of Sudan right now. We send our love and prayers to the families who have lost someone. It's important to remember that even in sad times, there are always kind people who try to help and support each other.

When sad things happen, it reminds us to be extra careful when we are near water. Always listen to grown-ups, and if you are ever on a boat, make sure you have a life jacket on. Safety first, always!

What We Can Learn

This sad news reminds us of a few important things. Firstly, it shows us how important our rivers are, but also how we must respect them and be safe when we are near them. Secondly, it shows us the power of people helping people. Even when things are tough, there are always kind hearts ready to lend a hand.

Let's keep the people of Sudan in our thoughts. We hope the search efforts continue to bring some answers and that the families find strength in each other and in the kindness of their community. Africa is one big family, and we care about each other, no matter where we are.
summary: A boat carrying people, including children, sank in Sudan's River Nile, causing at least 21 deaths, and brave helpers are still searching for those missing.
whyMatters: This story matters because it shows how important it is for everyone to be safe on boats, especially in big rivers like the Nile, and it reminds us how kind people help each other when sad things happen in our African family.

title: England to face Spain and Croatia in Nations League

title: NI relish 'competitive' Nations League draw - O'Neill
content: Northern Ireland manager Michael O'Neill says "there are no easy games" in the Nations League after being drawn with Hungary, Ukraine and Georgia.
